definition: to boost support or interest/to campaign/to promote
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops

sentences.english: The candidate's campaign was attended with too much ballyhoo .
sentences.chinese: 這個候選人的競選活動致力於太多的大舉造勢。

sentences.english: The man threw leaflets for a write-in campaign for mayor before police pulled him up and arrested him.
sentences.chinese: 這名男子一直在朝下扔傳單，爲市長的競選活動造勢。

sentences.english: And the  spin  that the government puts on building a  harmonious society  is sickeningly syrupy.
sentences.chinese: 而且政府建立“和諧社會”的造勢甜得令人暈倒。

sentences.english: Anti-nuclear activists marched in Japan Monday to build momentum for their movement.
sentences.chinese: 反核活動人士星期一在日本遊行，爲他們的運動造勢。

sentences.english: Lam began to gain momentum for a game. It's "Heaven II"this time.
sentences.chinese: 俊傑也開始爲遊戲造勢了，這次是《天堂II》。

sentences.english: Since the book, Bush participated in many TV show for the book campaign trail.
sentences.chinese: 出書以來，小布什參加多檔電視節目爲新書宣傳造勢。

sentences.english: I like one strategy China is employing to promote its own movies.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡中國政府爲自己電影宣傳造勢的某個策略。

sentences.english: Many candidates ballyhoo their campaigning in the street.
sentences.chinese: 許多候選人在街上爲他們的競選活動大舉造勢。

sentences.english: Zhao to let everybody back to their homes today to buildup.
sentences.chinese: 趙來讓大家各回各家準備今天的造勢活動。

definition: to assist in a candidate's election campaign (Tw)
to adjust one's head and turn one's face (idiom); cosmetic changes/Despite superficially new policies, the substance remains unchanged.
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to rise in revolt/to raise difficult questions
could happen at any moment/on the verge
to offer advice/to make a suggestion
to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
to make a profit/to gain/to get an advantage
to throw one's life in for/to haplessly give one's life for/to sacrifice oneself torturously working for another or for a group/to pour in one's utmost effort/to shed one's last ounce of strength for
Chen Shui-Bian (1950-), Taiwanese DPP 民進黨|民进党 politician, president of the Republic of China 2000-2008
